intro: Tristellateia ambondrensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star-fig, is a unique plant native to the eastern region of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Moraceae, which includes figs and mulberries, and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are typically green when mature, and it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
